nodes.bodyText: For the complaint functionality we need the course in order to determine if the course allows for complaints

maybe we should use the server time (provided by ArtemisServerDateService) instead - otherwise students might can cheat the review times on the client. I don't know if that can be a problem, because we have the check on the server, but might be a problem if a student is in a different time zone? Not sure though
Yes that is a good idea, i will use the server date

        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        "complaintNotAllowedTooltip": "Currently not allowed: complaint limit reached or assessment review period is over",
          
          
            
                        "complaintNotAllowedTooltip": "Currently not allowed: complaint limit reached or assessment review period is over.",
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,7 +14,7 @@
             "submit": "Submit a complaint",
             "created": "Your complaint has been submitted!",
             "moreInfo": "Complain",
-            "complaintNotAllowedTooltip": "Currently not allowed: complaint limit reached or assessment is older than one week",
+            "complaintNotAllowedTooltip": "Currently not allowed: complaint limit reached or assessment review period is over",
